snippet: The 2012 law intends for an advisory panel to oversee large banks’ practices on foreclosures and loans to small businesses.
abstract: Federal Judge Katherine Polk Failla strikes down New York City law requiring banks to publicly disclose details of their efforts to be socially responsible; city representatives express disappointment, saying rule was crucial for understanding bank behavior in low- and middle-income neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: The 2012 law intends for an advisory panel to oversee large banks’ practices on foreclosures and loans to small businesses.

headline.main: New York City’s Responsible Banking Act Is Unconstitutional, a Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: New York City Banking Law Is Unconstitutional, a Judge Rules
